common_issues.title: PiecesOS startup failure and slow boot
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch or experiencing slow boot times, particularly after updates. The issues seem to stem from core dependency errors, potential conflicts with older OS versions or specific setups, and stricter hardware requirements in newer releases. Proposed solutions included reinstalling, updating to the latest version (11.1.2), and providing logs for analysis.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## PiecesOS Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Multiple users reported issues with PiecesOS startup, including:
    * Stuck on "ensure core dependencies" step
    * Unable to access PiecesOS in the system tray
    * PFD unable to connect
    * Browser redirect to a warning page suggesting restart
* Shamas-Habib reported their issue with PiecesOS on Windows 10
* Jason Wilson reported their issue with PiecesOS on MacOS Monterey
* Rogierlegit reported their issue with PiecesOS on MacOS Monterey

**Problems Identified:**

* Potential migration issues with older Windows machines
* Potential user configuration issues
* Potential processor limitations
* One user reported a conflict with OneDrive on Windows
* On MacOS, the issue was determined to be a bug in the PiecesOS Desktop App

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **General:**
    * Uninstalling and reinstalling PiecesOS
    * Updating to the latest version (11.1.1)
    * Troubleshooting user configurations
    * Patching the PiecesOS Desktop App (3.3.8) to prevent hanging
* **For Shamas-Habib:**
    * No specific solution was implemented due to the user opening a new issue for their problem
* **For Jason Wilson:**
    * Removing the com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive solved the issue
* **For Rogierlegit:**
    * Closing and reopening the PiecesOS Desktop App resolved the issue

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Shamas-Habib's issue is being tracked in a separate issue
* Jason Wilson's issue is resolved
* Rogierlegit's issue is resolved
* The bug causing the issue on MacOS will be fixed in the next update of the PiecesOS Desktop App

**Additional Notes:**

* The PiecesOS team is actively working on resolving the migration issues
* Users are encouraged to check the PiecesOS documentation and YouTube channel for resources
* The PiecesOS team is available for support through email and calendar appointments
* This summary is based on the information available in the GitHub issue thread as of 2025-02-18.

### Software

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i had no issues with it in the begining but now when i try to open it now i encounter this error message 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e929cf56-d8a1-4185-8167-867ede2048e7)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:** The user (C2mokete) reported slow boot times in PiecesOS, potentially related to their Mac model and setup.

**Problems identified:** The user was experiencing delayed boot times on their Mac running PiecesOS, possibly caused by dependency issues.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:** 
* The Pieces support bot suggested related issues and resources for troubleshooting.
* Mark-at-pieces, a Pieces team member, informed the user about a new release (11.1.2 PiecesOS) that addressed the boot-up time issue.

**Current status/outcome:** The issue was closed after the new release was suggested. 

**Additional notes:**
* The outcome of the solution is not confirmed by the user.
* If the issue persists, the user is encouraged to reopen the issue.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* DevWizard24 reported an issue preventing them from launching Pieces.
* Support bot suggested relevant existing issues and resources.
* GetReal444 confirmed the same problem and offered to provide logs.
* Mark-at-pieces acknowledged the issue, related it to stricter hardware requirements in 11.1.1, and requested logs for analysis.
* tsavo-at-pieces mentioned a related issue (#625) and a planned release to mitigate the problem.
* After the release, mark-at-pieces suggested updating to 11.1.2 for verification.
* DevWizard24 confirmed the update and thanked the team.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces was not launching due to stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Analyzing support logs for troubleshooting.
* Releasing a patch (version 11.1.2) to address the hardware requirement issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved with the release of version 11.1.2.
* DevWizard24 confirmed the fix and the issue was closed. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of providing detailed information and logs when reporting issues.
* The Pieces team was responsive and addressed the problem promptly.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to missing AVX2 support
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch on Ubuntu, Windows, and macOS after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue was linked to a database extension requiring AVX2 CPU instruction set support. The Pieces team resolved the issue by releasing version 11.1.2, which included a fix for the AVX2 requirement. Users experiencing this issue are advised to upgrade to the latest PiecesOS version.

related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Rohit0072 reported an issue with booting up the Pieces application.
* The issue seems related to previous reports (#620, #624, and #625).

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces application was not booting up.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces support team offered resources and assistance.
* Tsavo identified the issue and planned a fix release by EOD on Feb 13, 2025.
* The latest version of PiecesOS (11.1.2) was suggested as a solution.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user was advised to update to PiecesOS 11.1.2.
* The issue was closed, pending user confirmation of resolution.

**Additional notes:**

* The user has not responded to the latest suggestions, so the issue's resolution remains unconfirmed.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User reported being unable to boot the PiecesOS application.
* User provided logs showing a "DatabaseException" error related to "AVX2 not supported".
* User's issue turned out to be caused by a hardware requirement related to the database service.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS was incompatible with certain hardware due to AVX2 requirement.
* This caused boot issues for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and actively worked on a solution.
* A patch was released within 48 hours to address the hardware requirement.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Users were advised to update to the latest PiecesOS version (11.1.2).
* User confirmed the update successfully resolved the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to have affected multiple users.
* The Pieces team was quick to identify and address the problem.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @gonzososa reported an issue where PiecesOS was unable to launch.
* The issue was identified as being related to the vector library needing AVX2 support, which is not present on older CPUs.
* The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and worked on a solution.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team released version 11.1.2, which included a fix for the AVX2 issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User @gonzososa confirmed that the issue was fixed with version 11.1.2.

**Additional Information:**

* The issue was related to a known problem with the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension requiring AVX2 support.
* Other users may encounter the same issue if they are using older CPUs that do not support AVX2.

**Overall, the issue was successfully resolved by the Pieces team.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to connect to cloud services or download local LLMs, and encountering launch issues. This is often due to network configuration, firewall restrictions, or stricter hardware requirements in recent versions. Solutions include verifying network settings, checking firewall rules, providing logs for analysis, and updating to the latest PiecesOS version.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summarized GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Rohanrathi99 is experiencing trouble making requests to PiecesOS cloud services and using local models.

**Key points raised:**

* Issue automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* Similar issues identified and helpful resources provided.
* Additional logs requested for debugging.
* Real-time debugging option offered.

**Problems identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking outgoing requests.
* Local models not functioning correctly.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Logs requested for analysis.
* Real-time debugging session offered.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Mark-at-pieces requests additional information for further investigation.
* Issue remains open pending resolution.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation was initiated on February 16, 2025 and the latest update is from February 18, 2025. 
* The issue author is Rohanrathi99 and the assigned Pieces team member is Mark-at-pieces.

Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Unable to download local LLMs

**Key Points:**

* User @AmanSingh766 reported an issue with downloading local LLMs in Pieces.
* The issue involved an exception: "Connection closed before full header was received".
* Support requested logs and information about the frequency of the error.

**Problems Identified:**

* User was unable to download local LLMs.
* The root cause of the connection closure was not identified.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support suggested providing logs and confirming if the error occurred consistently.
* The issue was potentially resolved in version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user did not provide further information, so the resolution is unclear. 
* Support suggested reopening the issue if the problem persisted.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* DevWizard24 reported an issue preventing them from launching Pieces.
* Support bot suggested relevant existing issues and resources.

* Mark-at-pieces acknowledged the issue, related it to stricter hardware requirements in 11.1.1, and requested logs for analysis.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of providing detailed information and logs when reporting issues.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to boot or launch, particularly after updating to versions 11.1.0 and 11.1.1. This was attributed to potential incompatibility with Apple Silicon Macs and stricter hardware requirements. Solutions included reinstalling the correct version, providing logs for analysis, and updating to version 11.1.2, which addressed the hardware requirement issue.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 ## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary **Key Points:** * The issue has been resolved. **Problems Identified:** * The original issue text is not provided, so the specific problems identified are unknown. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * The solution implemented is also unknown, as the issue text is missing. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is marked as "resolved" by mark-at-pieces on February 17, 2025. **Additional Notes:** * Without the original issue text, it is impossible to provide a more detailed summary.

related_issues.title: core services
related_issues.text:
core services
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i had no issues with it in the begining but now when i try to open it now i encounter this error message 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e929cf56-d8a1-4185-8167-867ede2048e7)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:** The user (C2mokete) reported slow boot times in PiecesOS, potentially related to their Mac model and setup.

**Problems identified:** The user was experiencing delayed boot times on their Mac running PiecesOS, possibly caused by dependency issues.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:** 
* The Pieces support bot suggested related issues and resources for troubleshooting.
* Mark-at-pieces, a Pieces team member, informed the user about a new release (11.1.2 PiecesOS) that addressed the boot-up time issue.

**Current status/outcome:** The issue was closed after the new release was suggested. 

**Additional notes:**
* The outcome of the solution is not confirmed by the user.
* If the issue persists, the user is encouraged to reopen the issue.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving PiecesOS boot and launch issues:** These issues are the most frequent and impactful, affecting users across different operating systems. Focus on addressing root causes, such as hardware incompatibility and dependency errors.

**Improve communication about hardware and software requirements:** Clearly communicate minimum system requirements for PiecesOS, especially CPU instruction set support (AVX2), to prevent installation and launch issues.

**Enhance error messaging and troubleshooting documentation:** Provide more informative error messages to users, guiding them towards relevant solutions. Update documentation with detailed troubleshooting steps for common issues.

**Investigate and address network connectivity problems:**  Diagnose the root causes of cloud service and local LLM connection issues. Provide clear instructions for users to verify network settings and firewall configurations.

**Consider a more robust testing and release process:** Implement rigorous testing for new PiecesOS versions across different hardware and software configurations to identify potential issues before release.
**Proactively monitor user feedback and support channels:** Regularly analyze support tickets, community forums, and other feedback channels to identify emerging issues and trends.
